name: Ibraheem Adeneye
reason: Convicted of conspiracy to commit marriage fraud, marriage fraud, naturalization fraud, and making a false statement to a federal agency. Adeneye indicated that he was engaged in brokering sham marriages between Nigerian nationals and U.S. citizens so that the Nigerians could obtain immigration benefits, ultimately leading to U.S. citizenship. In return, the U.S. citizen "spouses" received cash payments to assist the Nigerians in the deception.
reasonCategory: All other reasons
status: U.S. District Judge Kenneth Hoyt sentenced Adeneye to the time he has already served in prison. The judge granted the government's motion to strip Adeneye of his U.S. citizenship. Adeneye became an alien subject to removal from the United States to Nigeria.

name: Solomon Adler
reason: Government economist under investigation as a communist spy. Moved to Britain and was denaturalized after his passport expired.
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Renewed American citizenship when Sino-American diplomatic relations were reestablished in 1971.

name: Rasmi Khader Almallah
reason: Became a permanent resident via a 1981 marriage four days before his student visa expired (later deemed "a green card marriage" by the Immigration and Naturalization Service) and naturalized in 1988. Almallah was stripped of his United States citizenship after coming to the authorities' attention for his connection to the Holy Land Foundation (adjudged to be a Hamas fundraising entity) and also as a former employer of one of the 9/11 bombers.
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Appealed unsuccessfully to the United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Resident of Jordan, where he is a member of the Jordanian Senate.

name: Basil Artishenko
reason: Member of Nazi-controlled police in Khoiniki (present-day Chojniki, Belarus), accused of helping execute about 100 unarmed people.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Not deported from the United States in a settlement with the government that required him to give up his citizenship and nationality in 1984; died in 1989.

name: Andrija Artukovič
reason: Croatian Minister of Interior 1941-1942; 1943.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Yugoslavkia requested extradition 1951; request rejected 1959; deported 1986 to Yugoslavkia died in prison 1988

name: Jan Awdziej
reason: Mayor of Stolpce in Nazi-occupied Poland.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Left the country in February 1984 for West Germany, where he renounced his U.S. citizenship as part of a deal to avoid prosecution. Died in 1998.

name: Martin Bartesch
reason: Failure to disclose his past when he applied for U.S. citizenship: member of the Prinz Eugen Division of the S.S. from 1943–44; while a guard at Mauthausen concentration camp, he shot Gottfried Ochshorn dead when Ochshorn attempted to escape.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Austria, where he later died.

name: Anton Baumann
reason: SS Death Head's Battalion guard at Stutthof and Buchenwald concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Ordered deported to Germany in 1993, but deportation was never carried out due to his health; died in 1994.

name: Aldo Mario Bellei
reason: Born in Italy to an Italian father and an American mother, Bellei lost his citizenship for not moving to and living in the United States for at least five years prior to his 28th birthday; see Rogers v. Bellei.
reasonCategory: All other reasons
status: U.S. Supreme Court vacated lower court ruling, finding against Bellei in 1971. Provision under which Bellei was denaturalized was repealed (Public Law 95-432) by Congress in 1978.

name: Wolodymyr Berezowskyj
reason: Guard at Trawniki, Poniatowa, and Gusen concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Never deported from the United States due to his health; died in 2010.

name: Petras Bernotavičius
reason: Deputy to Nazi-appointed mayor and police commander Werner Loew in Kupiškis, Lithuania.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Lithuania in 2002, where he later died.

name: Anton Bless
reason: SS-Death's Head Battalion guard at Auschwitz concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Germany in 1992, where he died in 2004.

name: Hermine Braunsteiner
reason: Failure to disclose conviction for war crimes; female concentration camp guard.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: First Nazi war criminal extradited from the United States to Germany. Sentenced to life imprisonment, but released in 1996 for health reasons.

name: Ildefonsas Bučmys
reason: Guard at Majdanek concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Not deported from the United States in a settlement with the government that required him to give up his U.S. citizenship and nationality in 2005; he died later that same year.

name: Juozas Budreika
reason: Member of the Lithuanian Schutzmannschaft.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Lithuania on May 14, 1996 in an agreement with the OSI. Died less than a month after arriving in Lithuania.

name: Kazys Čiurinskas
reason: Member of the Lithuanian Schutzmannschaft.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Lithuania in 1999 after consenting to deportation.

name: Algimantas Dailidė
reason: For having "illegally procured" citizenship. Member of the Lithuanian Security Police during World War II.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Germany in 2004 after being ordered deported. Convicted by a Lithuanian court in 2006, but not imprisoned due to his age. Still lives in Germany.

name: Damrah, Fawaz Mohammed
reason: Imam who was convicted on June 18, 2004 of lying on his naturalization application about his association with three groups classified as terrorist organizations by the U.S. government.
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Deported to the Palestinian West Bank in January 2007.

name: John Demjanjuk
reason: Allegedly concealed being a concentration camp guard at Sobibor, Majdanek, Flossenbürg, and Trawniki, thus committing naturalization fraud.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Deported to Germany. On July 13, 2009, Demjanjuk was formally charged with 28,060 counts of accessory to murder, one for each person who died at Sobibor during the time he was accused of serving as a guard at the Nazi death camp. On November 30, 2009, Demjanjuk's trial began in Munich. Convicted by Germany in 2011, but released from custody pending his appeal. Died in 2012 before appeal could be heard, thus the Munich District court declared him "presumed innocent". The court confirmed that, in accordance with German law, Demjanjuk's previous interim conviction had been invalidated and that Demjanjuk was without a criminal record.

name: Jakob Frank Denzinger
reason: Guard at Mauthausen, St. Georgen, Kraków, and Auschwitz concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to West Germany in August 1989; living in Croatia as of 2014.

name: Michael Derkacz
reason: Member of the Ukrainian police who "assisted the Nazis in persecuting civilian Jews."
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Derkacz failed to file a notice of appeal against this summary judgment before the time for such an appeal expired, and the revocation of his citizenship thus became final. He died in August 1983 before his deportation hearings were scheduled to begin.

name: Valdis Didrichsons
reason: Member of Arajs Kommando military unit in Nazi-occupied Latvia.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Never deported from the United States due to his health; died in 1995.

name: Feodor Fedorenko
reason: Guard at Treblinka extermination camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Extradited to the Soviet Union, where he was executed.

name: Osyp Firishchak
reason: Member of the Ukrainian Auxiliary Police.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Ordered deported by an immigration judge; appeal denied by Supreme Court on February 21, 2012. Died later that same year.

name: Adam Friedrich
reason: Guard at Gross-Rosen, Dyhernfurth, and Flossenbürg concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in July 2006 before deportation proceedings could begin.

name: Orest Galan
reason: Member of the Ukrainian Auxiliary Police
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Ordered to leave United States by November 15, 2006 in settlement agreement with the OSI. Returned to Ukraine.

name: Anton Geiser
reason: SS Death's Head Battalion guard at Sachsenhausen and Buchenwald.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in 2012 while appealing his deportation.

name: Kazys Gimžauskas
reason: Deputy to Aleksandras Lileikis in the Lithuanian Security Police.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Lithuania in 1993 or 1994. Convicted by a Lithuanian court in 2001, but not imprisoned "after experts concluded he was not mentally fit to take responsibility for his past actions." Died shortly afterward.

name: Emma Goldman
reason: Anarchist.
reasonCategory: All other reasons
status: Deported on December 21, 1919; landed in Finland on January 17, 1920, and sent from there to the Russian border.

name: Mikhail Gorshkow
reason: Former interrogator for the Gestapo accused of participating in the murders of about 3,000 people.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Estonia before being denaturalized. Died in 2013.

name: Jadranko Gostič
reason: Served in the Zvornik Infantry Brigade of the Bosnian Serb Army from April 1992 until December 1995; concealed involvement in war crimes in Bosnia, including Srebrenica (1995).
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Deported to Serbia in 2010 after agreeing to admit to the allegations against him, be denaturalized and surrender any claim to lawful permanent resident status.

name: Juozas Grabauskas
reason: Member of the Lithuanian Schutzmannschaft.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Repatriated to Lithuania as per settlement with the OSI in November 1993; died in 2002.

name: Vytautas Gudauskas

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Not deported from the United States in a settlement with the government that required him to give up his U.S. citizenship; died in 1997.

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Never deported from the United States due to his health; died in 1995.

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Not deported as no country would accept him; died in 2005.

name: Ferdinand Hammer
reason: Alleged (never proven) SS guard at Auschwitz and Sachsenhausen concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Deported to Austria in 2000, where he died in 2004.

name: Johann Hansl
reason: SS Death's Head Battalion guard at the Sachsenhausen and Natzweiler concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in 2007 in Des Moines, Iowa before deportation proceedings could begin.

name: Martin Hartmann
reason: SS Death's Head Battalion guard at Sachsenhausen concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Agreed to permanently depart the United States for Germany on August 31, 2007 in an agreement with the OSI. Believed to be living in Berlin.

name: Anatoly Hrusitzky
reason: Member of Nazi-controlled police force in Cherny Ostrov, Ukraine
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Venezuela in 1984, where he renounced his United States citizenship and later died in 1992.

name: Sergis Hutyrczyk
reason: Guard at Koldyczewo concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in 1993 while appealing his denaturalization.

name: Lionel Jean-Baptiste
reason: Failure to "establish and maintain 'good moral character'"[97] due to conviction as a drug dealer after application for citizenship, but before his naturalization on April 23, 1996.
reasonCategory: All other reasons
status: Denied entry to Haiti, his homeland, after denaturalization, on the grounds he had relinquished his Haitian citizenship by becoming a U.S. citizen. Jailed in 2006 for a subsequent drug-related crime. Released on an Order of Supervision after the United States Supreme Court ruled that foreigners who could not be deported could not be detained indefinitely.

name: Gilberto Jordan
reason: Participated in the Dos Erres massacre, Guatemala in December 1982.
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Currently serving 10-year prison sentence at FDC Miami for naturalization fraud.

name: Liudvikas Kairys
reason: Platoon leader at Treblinka.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Deported to Germany in 1993. Germany suspended its investigation of him in 1999, by which time he had died.

name: Jan Kalymun
reason: Service in Nazi-affiliated Ukrainische Hilfspolizei (Ukrainian Auxiliary Police) during World War II. The U.S. Justice Department says Kalymon claimed to have shot and killed a Jew in 1942 when Jews were being removed from what is now Lviv, Ukraine. He later denied having done so.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in 2014 while awaiting extradition to Germany.

name: Juris Kauls
reason: Deputy chief and inspector of guards at a concentration camp near Riga, Latvia.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to West Germany in August 1988. Died in Latvia in 2008.

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Never deported from the United States due to his health; died in 1994.

status: Not deported from the United States in a settlement with the government that required him to give up his U.S. citizenship and nationality in 1988; died in 1993.

name: Paul Knauer
reason: False oath of allegiance due to affiliations with German-American Bund, German-American Citizens Alliance and the German Winter Relief Fund, the last being an official agency of the German government for which German consulates solicited money in the United States.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Regained entry to the United States in 1957.

name: Ferenc Koréh
reason: Editor of the Hungarian pro-Axis newspaper Szekely Nep.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Ordered deported in 1997, but deportation was not carried out due to his health; died later that same year.

status: Fled to Paraguay in 1987. Died in 1998.

status: Fled to Costa Rica in 1985, where he died in 2003.

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Citizenship ordered to be stripped from him. Not deported.

name: Wasyl Krysa

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in 2004, while appealing his denaturalization.

name: Fritz Julius Kuhn
reason: Fraud in naturalization process.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Leader of the German American Bund. Jailed as an enemy agent, and deported to Germany in late 1945.

name: Josias Kumpf
reason: SS Death's Head Guard at Sachsenhausen and Trawniki.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Deported to Austria in 2009, where he died later that year.

name: Juozas Kungys
reason: Making false statements on his visa application.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in Hudson County, New Jersey in 2009.

name: Andrew Kuras
reason: Guard at Trawniki, Poniatowa, and Dorohucza concentration camps; member of SS Battalion Striebel.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Never deported from the United States due to his health; died in 2007.

name: Fedir Kwoczak

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in 2003 while appealing his denaturalization.

name: Stefan Leili
reason: SS Death's Head guard at Mauthausen concentration camp who admitted shooting a 17-year-old French Jew, Leon Axelroud, during an escape attempt.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to West Germany in August 1986, where he died in 1995.

name: Johann Leprich
reason: SS Death's Head Battalion guard at Mauthausen concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Not deported as no country would accept him; died in 2013.

status: Returned to Lithuania in 1996. War crimes trial suspended in 2000 due to ill health of defendant, who died the same year, aged 93.

name: Karl Linnas
reason: Making false statements to gain citizenship. Commandant of a Nazi concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Deported to the Soviet Union. Died while awaiting trial.

name: Wasyl Lytwyn

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Has not been deported due to his health.

name: Jakob Miling
reason: SS Death's Head Battalion guard at Gross-Rosen and Sachsenhausen concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Serbia in September 2002, where he renounced his U.S. citizenship a year later and died in 2009.

name: Adolfas Milinavičius
reason: Member of the Lithuanian Security Police.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Lithuania in 1996, where he died in 1999.

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Deported to Lithuania in September 1992, where he died on November 24, 1997.

name: A. K. Mozumdar
reason: Claimed to be Caucasian to satisfy a law then in effect restricting naturalization to "free white persons", becoming the first Asian Indian to gain American citizenship. United States v. Bhagat Singh Thind ruled that Asian Indians were not white.
reasonCategory: All other reasons

name: Beatrice Munyenyezi
reason: Member of the National Republican Movement for Democracy and Development, assisted in the Rwandan Genocide
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Currently serving 10-year prison sentence at FCI Aliceville for naturalization fraud.

name: Michael Negele
reason: Guard and attack dog handler at Sachsenhausen and Theresienstadt concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Not deported as no country would accept him; died in 2008.

name: Kelbessa Negewo
reason: Convicted in Ethiopia in absentia of torture as a member of the then-ruling Derg.
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Deported to Ethiopia, where he is serving a life sentence.

name: Rasmea Odeh
reason: Convicted and sentenced by an Israeli court to life in prison for: (i) her involvement in two terrorist bombings in Jerusalem; and (ii) involvement in an illegal organization, the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP). Odeh was sentenced to 18 months in federal prison on March 12, 2015 for immigration fraud and for concealing her arrest, conviction, and imprisonment for fatal terrorist bombing. She was stripped of her United States citizenship, and will be deported from the United States to Jordan once she is done serving her time.
reasonCategory: Serious crimes, suspicion of spying for the communists, or association with terrorists
status: Sentenced to be deported to Jordan.

name: Wolodymir Osidach

name: Jakiw Palij

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Remains in the United States, as no country has been found to accept him.

name: Mečys Paškevičius
reason: Failed to disclose his World War II era service in the Nazi-affiliated Lithuanian Security Police from 1941–44
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Never deported from the United States due to his health; died in 1993.

name: Nada Nadim Prouty
reason: Former CIA agent who pleaded guilty two felonies related to a sham (green card) marriage and to one misdemeanor count of unauthorized use of an FBI computer. Renounced all claims to United States citizenship.
reasonCategory: All other reasons
status: Granted withholding of deportation/removal due to perceived threat to her life in her native Lebanon; she must comply with an Order of Supervision issued by the Department of Homeland Security.

name: Peter Quintus
reason: SS guard at Majdanek concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Never deported from the United States due to his health; died in 1997.

name: Stefan Reger

reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to West Germany in 1988, where he died in 2003.

name: Jakob Reimer
reason: Trawniki concentration camp guard.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died before he could be deported to Germany.

name: Hiram Cristobal Reve
reason: Committed naturalization fraud when he failed to disclose his July 12, 1995 arrest for sexually assaulting a 14-year-old boy in May 1995 when submitting his naturalization application dated July 27, 1995. United States Attorney for the District of New Jersey Chris Christie (later Governor of New Jersey) successfully concluded that Reve knowingly tried to deceive the federal government in not disclosing his arrest.
reasonCategory: All other reasons
status: Reve presently resides in New Jersey as a legal permanent resident due to the existing "wet feet, dry feet" policy on repatriating Cuban nationals back to Cuba.

name: Arthur Rudolph
reason: German rocket scientist who worked on the V-2. Renounced citizenship under pressure.

status: Remained in the U.S. after denaturalization as no other country would accept him. He died in 2010.

name: Josef Wieland
reason: SS Death's Head guard at Mauthausen concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to West Germany in 1986, where he died in 1992.

name: Joseph Wittje
reason: Waffen SS guard at Sachsenhausen concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Died in 2006 before deportation hearings could begin.

name: Chester Wojciechowski
reason: Guard at the Majdanek concentration camp.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to West Germany, where he died in 2003.

name: Vladas Zajančkauskas
reason: Trawniki concentration camp guard who participated in the Nazi operation at the Warsaw Ghetto.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Ordered deported by an immigration judge; appeal denied by Supreme Court on November 18, 2010.

name: Johann Ziegler
reason: SS Death's Head guard at Stutthof, Kauen, and Gotenhafen concentration camps.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Fled to Austria in 1991; died in 1997.

name: Martin Zultner
reason: Guard at Schwechat, Floridsdorf, and Modling, three subcamps of Mauthausen in Austria.
reasonCategory: Hiding World War II crimes or association with Nazis
status: Moved to Austria in 1975, where he renounced his U.S. citizenship in 1990 and later died in 1997.
